titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:03-0400

did.abstract: The first three volumes contain journals of Strahan's travels in Scotland, with records of expenses along the way, for 1751, 1759, 1760, 1766, 1768, 1773, and 1777. Strahan and Benjamin Franklin were in Edinburgh at the same time in 1759. The fourth volume contains "The particulars of the estate of Wm Strahan as it stood on the first of January 1755," and also for 1759 and 1761, with some miscellaneous accounts.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Film 54-66. Frame 204 Film 867 Canklin references only

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: William Strahan was a London printer and publisher, member of Parliament, and friend of Benjamin Franklin.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This large and rich collection chronicles the daily activity of William Strahan during his travels through Scotland in 1751, 1759, 1760, 1766, 1768, 1773, 1777. Strahan was one of the largest printers and exporters of printed material in Great Britain. The journal records his daily activities and observations and also lends insight into his business connections and relations. Volumes two and four also contain business records.

controlaccess.subject: American Revolution
International Travel
Printing and Publishing
controlaccess.geogname: Scotland -- Description and travel -- Early works to 1800.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vo1.1 consists of 45 leaves, of which 30 contain writing. It consists of an account of a journey and list of expenses by Messrs.Hitch, Lowth and Strahan; July 6-Aug. 28, 1751.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vol. 2 consists of 30 leaves of which 24 contain writing. It consists of accounts of journeys to Scotland; Jan. 1, 1759-Aug. 22, 1759; July 26-Sept. 24, 1759; July 23 - Aug. 22, 1759; Aug. 4 - Aug. 22, 1760; and Aug. 19 - Sept. 17, 1766. Refers to the "messrs Franklin" on Sept. 13, 1759.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vol. 3 consists of 36 leaves of which 21 contain writing. It consists of accounts of journey to Scotland; June 26 - Sept 7., 1768; July 17 - Sept. 27, 1773; and July 1 - Sept. 10, 1777.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vol. 4 consists of 27 leaves of which 16 contain writing. Reference to B. Franklin is made on p.[6] and p. [22]. Reference is made to W. Franklin on p. [23].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p.and add. (see William Strahan papers. No.x1) Forwards manuscript for correction and editing. Introduces Richard Henderson and requests an introduction to "Frankland" for him. For introduction, see F.P.vol. 19, 45.
